{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "08927d2e",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Bandwidth search\n",
    "\n",
    "To find out the optimal bandwidth, `gwlearn` provides a `BandwidthSearch` class, which trains models on a range of bandwidths and selects the most optimal one."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "id": "d195603f",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import geopandas as gpd\n",
    "from geodatasets import get_path\n",
    "\n",
    "from gwlearn.ensemble import GWRandomForestClassifier\n",
    "from gwlearn.linear_model import GWLinearRegression\n",
    "from gwlearn.search import BandwidthSearch"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "6c5818bb",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Get sample data"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "id": "52506ed8",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "gdf = gpd.read_file(get_path(\"geoda.ncovr\")).to_crs(5070)\n",
    "\n",
    "gdf['point'] = gdf.representative_point()\n",
    "gdf = gdf.set_geometry('point')\n",
    "\n",
    "y = gdf[\"FH90\"]\n",
    "X = gdf.iloc[:, 9:15]"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "3cab5e61",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Interval search\n",
    "\n",
    "Interval search tests the model at a set interval."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "id": "9519f942",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Bandwidth: 50.00, aicc: 15666.353\n",
      "Bandwidth: 150.00, aicc: 15498.936\n",
      "Bandwidth: 250.00, aicc: 15660.999\n",
      "Bandwidth: 350.00, aicc: 15775.129\n",
      "Bandwidth: 450.00, aicc: 15854.287\n",
      "Bandwidth: 550.00, aicc: 15918.673\n",
      "Bandwidth: 650.00, aicc: 15975.564\n",
      "Bandwidth: 750.00, aicc: 16031.276\n",
      "Bandwidth: 850.00, aicc: 16080.155\n",
      "Bandwidth: 950.00, aicc: 16126.986\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<gwlearn.search.BandwidthSearch at 0x17f353bc0>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 8,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "search = BandwidthSearch(\n",
    "    GWLinearRegression,\n",
    "    geometry=gdf.geometry,\n",
    "    fixed=False,\n",
    "    n_jobs=-1,\n",
    "    search_method=\"interval\",\n",
    "    min_bandwidth=50,\n",
    "    max_bandwidth=1000,\n",
    "    interval=100,\n",
    "    criterion=\"aicc\",\n",
    "    verbose=True,\n",
    ")\n",
    "search.fit(\n",
    "    X,\n",
    "    y,\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "c353c560",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The `scores_` series then contains the AICc, selected as the criterion, which can be plotted to see the change of the model performance as the bandwidth grows."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "id": "eb26a77e",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<Axes: >"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 9,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "search.scores_.plot()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "6730d313",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The optimal bandwidth is then the lowest one."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "id": "981fc19f",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "np.int64(150)"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 10,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "search.optimal_bandwidth_"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "8a274c07",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Golden section\n",
    "\n",
    "Alternatively, you can try to use the golden section algorithm that attempts to find the optimal bandwidth iteratively. However, note that there's no guaratnee that it will find the globally optimal bandwidth as it may stick to the local minimum."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "id": "79fc5a76",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Bandwidth: 918447.5, score: 16135.833\n",
      "Bandwidth: 1331552.5, score: 16367.508\n",
      "Bandwidth: 663120.61, score: 15901.394\n",
      "Bandwidth: 505326.89, score: 15734.258\n",
      "Bandwidth: 407799.68, score: 15644.228\n",
      "Bandwidth: 347527.21, score: 15599.261\n",
      "Bandwidth: 310274.74, score: 15585.033\n",
      "Bandwidth: 287252.47, score: 15579.996\n",
      "Bandwidth: 273023.14, score: 15583.440\n",
      "Bandwidth: 296045.75, score: 15580.453\n",
      "Bandwidth: 281817.09, score: 15580.952\n",
      "Bandwidth: 290610.83, score: 15579.452\n",
      "Bandwidth: 292686.98, score: 15579.549\n",
      "Bandwidth: 289328.29, score: 15579.566\n",
      "Bandwidth: 291404.06, score: 15579.440\n",
      "Bandwidth: 291893.95, score: 15579.458\n",
      "Bandwidth: 291100.94, score: 15579.438\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<gwlearn.search.BandwidthSearch at 0x331d955b0>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 13,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "search = BandwidthSearch(\n",
    "    GWLinearRegression,\n",
    "    geometry=gdf.geometry,\n",
    "    fixed=True,\n",
    "    n_jobs=-1,\n",
    "    search_method=\"golden_section\",\n",
    "    criterion=\"aicc\",\n",
    "    min_bandwidth=250_000,\n",
    "    max_bandwidth=2_000_000,\n",
    "    verbose=True,\n",
    ")\n",
    "search.fit(\n",
    "    X,\n",
    "    y,\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "98bbfbfa",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "You can see how the agorithm searches and iteratively gets closer to the optimum."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": null,
   "id": "3de716b6",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "np.float64(291100.9431339667)"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 19,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "search.optimal_bandwidth_"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "de4b0a8d",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [

  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "04810c85",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "You can also ask for a log loss and even use it as a criterion for the selection. This is useful when comparing classification models with varying prediction rate (you can also retrieve that for each bandwidth)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 27,
   "id": "82594ee3",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Bandwidth: 50.00, log_loss: 0.568\n",
      "Bandwidth: 150.00, log_loss: 0.550\n",
      "Bandwidth: 250.00, log_loss: 0.578\n",
      "Bandwidth: 350.00, log_loss: 0.617\n",
      "Bandwidth: 450.00, log_loss: 0.593\n",
      "Bandwidth: 550.00, log_loss: 0.553\n",
      "Bandwidth: 650.00, log_loss: 0.494\n",
      "Bandwidth: 750.00, log_loss: 0.524\n",
      "Bandwidth: 850.00, log_loss: 0.555\n",
      "Bandwidth: 950.00, log_loss: 0.571\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<gwlearn.search.BandwidthSearch at 0x30be6d370>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 27,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "search = BandwidthSearch(\n",
    "    GWRandomForestClassifier,\n",
    "    geometry=gdf.geometry,\n",
    "    fixed=False,\n",
    "    n_jobs=-1,\n",
    "    search_method=\"interval\",\n",
    "    min_bandwidth=50,\n",
    "    max_bandwidth=1000,\n",
    "    interval=100,\n",
    "    metrics=['log_loss', 'prediction_rate'],\n",
    "    criterion=\"log_loss\",\n",
    "    verbose=True,\n",
    ")\n",
    "search.fit(\n",
    "    X,\n",
    "    y > y.median(),  # simulate binary categorical variable\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "197418a8",
